itemDescription: British Army officer who commanded the 5th Infantry Brigade during the Falklands War

wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier Sir Mathew John Anthony Wilson, 6th Baronet, (2 October 1935 – 5 December 2019) was a British Army officer who commanded the 5th Infantry Brigade during the Falklands War.

link_mentions.page: British logistics in the Falklands War
response: Brigadier Tony Wilson's 5th Infantry Brigade reached Cumberland Bay off South Georgia Island on Queen Elizabeth 2 on 27 May. The politicians were nervous about the political repercussions if the ship were lost, so it was decided to unload it here, and move the brigade to the Falkland Islands in other ships. The Queen Elizabeth 2 was met by a veritable fleet of ships that proceeded to unload her passengers and cargo. The trawler cum minesweepers , , ,  and  ferried the infantry and the 16th (Parachute) Field Ambulance across to Canberra and Norland, which departed for San Carlos at 21:00 on 28 May. Cargo was unloaded onto Stromness, Resource, Saxonia, Lycaon, , British Esk, and British Tay.

link_mentions.page: List of people with surname Wilson
response: *Tony Wilson (British Army officer) (1935–2019), Brigadier during the Falklands Conflict

Anthony or Tony Wilson may refer to:
* Tony Wilson (1950–2007), TV presenter, co-founder of Factory Records
* Tony Wilson (musician) (born 1947), member of Hot Chocolate
* Tony Wilson (radio presenter), Australian author and radio presenter, 2000s

link_mentions.page: List of leaders of the Falklands War
response: * Tony Wilson was the Commanders of 5th Infantry Brigade
